alert.note: Alert for Cocke; Sevier (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 12 at 10:16PM CDT until July 13 at 2:15AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Morristown has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Cocke County in east Tennessee... Southeastern Sevier County in east Tennessee... * Until 315 AM EDT. * At 1116 PM EDT, emergency management reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Gatlinburg, Pittman Center, Cosby and Great Smoky Mountains National Park. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
